case_title: SALEEM CHAUDHRY TEXTILE MILLS (PVT.) LTD. vs FEDERATION OF PAKISTAN And Other
reference_no_or_id: Civil Petitions for Leave to Appeal Nos.1225-L to 1227-L of 1996; Writ Petitions Nos.5181, 5182 and 5841 of 1996
case_number: Civil Petitions for Leave to Appeal Nos.1225-L to 1227-L of 1996; Writ Petitions Nos.5181, 5182 and 5841 of 1996
complaint_summary: The appellants challenged the levy and recovery of taxes under sections 80-C, 80-CC, and 80-D of the Income Tax Ordinance.
judgment_summary: Leave to appeal was granted in line with prior petitions to address similar legal questions. Appeals will be heard collectively after notice to the Attorney-General. Recovery of taxes was suspended during the pendency of appeals, conditional upon appellants undertaking to pay taxes with 2% interest over the Bank rate if appeals are dismissed.
Decision_or_verdict: Leave granted; appeals to be heard collectively.
judgment_order: Leave to appeal has already been granted in Civil Petitions Nos.349 to 363-L of 1995 and others to consider the same questions of law as arise in these petitions. For that reason, leave is also granted in these petitions. All the appeals should be heard together after notice to the Attorney-General. During the pendency of the appeals, if the appellants undertake that they shall pay the tax as levied or leviable under sections 80-C, 80-CC, and 80-D of the Income Tax Ordinance, with interest at the rate of 2% over the Bank rate in the event the appeals are dismissed, the recovery of the tax shall remain suspended.
legal_arguments: Tax levied under sections 80-C, 80-CC, and 80-D of the Income Tax Ordinance.
Suspension of tax recovery conditional upon payment undertaking.
key_issues: Legality of tax levy under Income Tax Ordinance
Suspension of tax recovery during appeals

legal_terms.Leave to Appeal: Permission granted by a court to challenge a decision in a higher court.

words_and_phrases.Suspension of Recovery: Temporary halt in the enforcement of tax collection.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves the challenge of tax levies under sections of the Income Tax Ordinance. Leave to appeal was granted, and tax recovery was suspended conditionally. Appeals will be heard collectively.
